Key Match Events: Saud Shakeel and Muhammad Rizwan hit vital half-centuries
Pakistan bowled out for 286 off 49 overs
Scott De Leede hits impressive half-centuries but Dutch run-chase collapses
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan captain, Babar Azam, speaking after his side’s win
Netherlands captain, Scott Edwards, speaking after the game
Saud Shakeel, player of the match, speaking after the match
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan are very happy with the support from Hyderabad and the team has enjoyed their hospitality
It is a little bit disappointing. I thought we bowled and fielded really well, but to Pakistan’s credit, they made a few runs at the end
I was very pleased with my performance. I tried to follow my basics and be positive and score runs for the team
Miscellaneous Highlights: Netherlands fall to 81-run defeat against Pakistan in opening both side’s opening World Cup fixture
The way Hyderabad have supported [us], we’re very happy and the team has enjoyed their hospitality
We lost three wickets early but the way Mohammad Rizwan and Saud Shakeel started gave us momentum
The last two or three months I have been working on my game. I know I am going to bat at five for Pakistan so I’ve been trying to improve my attacking options and be brave to use them
